etymology.description: Semantic: 重(重) (zhòng, "heavy") + Phonetic: 力(力) (lì, "strength") = movement requires strength -> move; act
etymology.interpretation: 動(動) (dòng, "move; act") combines the idea of heaviness with strength, suggesting that movement or action often involves overcoming resistance or lifting weight.

examples.chinese: 他動起來很快(他動起來很快)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dòng qǐ lái hěn kuài.

examples.chinese: 机遇到来时(機遇到來時)，他决定动身出发(他決定動身出發)。
examples.pinyin: Jīyù dào lái shí, tā juédìng dòng shēn chūfā.
examples.english: When opportunity arrives, he decided to set off.

examples.chinese: 我们动起来更有效率(我們動起來更有效率)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen dòng qǐ lái gèng yǒuxiàolǜ.
examples.english: We become more efficient when we get moving.
